snippet: Use of the most commonly prescribed osteoporosis drugs fell 50 percent from 2008 to 2012 after reports of rotting jaws and snapped thighbones.
abstract: Osteoporosis experts are afraid that their increasingly urgent efforts to alter perceptions about extremely rare side effects of prescribed osteoporosis drugs will do little to change Americans' view that drugs are more risky than disease itself; reports of severe weakening of bones caused by drugs have overshadowed benefits they bring to vast majority of patients.
lead_paragraph: Use of the most commonly prescribed osteoporosis drugs fell 50 percent from 2008 to 2012 after reports of rotting jaws and snapped thighbones.

headline.main: Fearing Drugs’ Rare Side Effects, Millions Take Their Chances With Osteoporosis
headline.print_headline: Osteoporosis Drugs Shunned for Fear of Rare Side Effects
